## LineCursor.getNextNode() method

Get the next node in the AST, optionally allowing for loopback.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getNextNode(node: IFocusableNode | null, isValid: (p1: IFocusableNode | null) => boolean, loop: boolean): IFocusableNode | null;
```

</th><th>

</th><th>

Description

</td><td>

[IFocusableNode](./blockly.ifocusablenode_interface.md) \| null


</td><td>

The current position in the AST.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

isValid


</td><td>

(p1: [IFocusableNode](./blockly.ifocusablenode_interface.md) \| null) =&gt; boolean


</td><td>

A function true/false depending on whether the given node should be traversed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

loop


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

Whether to loop around to the beginning of the workspace if no valid node was found.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[IFocusableNode](./blockly.ifocusablenode_interface.md) \| null
